This article contains information about running Linux on the laptop ASUS X421IA which are known as ASUS Vivobook S14 M433 in Malaysia. The laptop are almost fully functional on Linux out of the box, requiring a few tweaks to meet a user's basic needs.

sections.title: Secure boot
sections.content: In order to boot Arch (or any OS not supporting Secure Boot), enter the UEFI parameters by holding F2 (or ESC key and then selecting "Firmware Setup"), then navigate with the keyboard arrows to the "Security" tab and set "Secure Boot" to Off.

sections.title: Fast startup
sections.content: If you are planning to dual boot with Windows, it is advisable to disable Fast Startup in the UEFI menu at the "Boot" tab. For more information, see Fast Startup.

sections.title: Suspend and Hibernation
sections.content: Unfortunately, Suspend to RAM is not available in this model. The supported suspension methods are suspend to idle and hibernate. To wake from suspend, simply press any keyboard keys other than the power button. Note that suspend may not work consistently. See #Freezing issue.

sections.title: Fingerprint sensor
sections.content: The fingerprint sensor (available to some models) are too small to be able to be enrolled and used successfully.

sections.title: Fan speed control
sections.content: Full fan speed control is not supported in this laptop. Only pwm1_enable is available for the asus-nb-wmi driver which can be set to 2 for automatic and 0 for maximum fan speed (6000 RPM). See Fan speed control#ASUS laptops.

sections.title: Freezing issue
sections.content:
Note: **The factual accuracy of this article or section is disputed.** The factual accuracy of this article or section is disputed.

The factual accuracy of this article or section is disputed.

Under certain circumstances (such as gaming or resuming from suspend), the screen may freeze and the user are not able to do anything except doing a force reboot. Before proceeding, make sure that the kernel, AMDGPU, AMD microcode and BIOS is updated.

sections.title: Gaming
sections.content:
```
kernel: [drm:amdgpu_dm_atomic_commit_tail [amdgpu]] *ERROR* Waiting for fences timed out!
kernel: [drm:amdgpu_job_timedout [amdgpu]] *ERROR* ring gfx timeout, but soft recovered
```

If you encounter freezing and the above error log while gaming, try adding amdgpu.noretry=0 to the kernel parameters. See freedesktop issue.

sections.title: Resuming from suspend
sections.content:
```
kernel: amdgpu 0000:03:00.0: [drm:amdgpu_ib_ring_tests [amdgpu]] *ERROR* IB test failed on gfx
kernel: [drm:process_one_work] *ERROR* ib ring test failed
```

If you encounter freezing and the above error log while resuming from suspend (particularly when suspend time is longer), try adding amd_iommu=on iommu=pt to the kernel parameters. See kernel issue.

sections.title: Backlight brightness cannot be restored at boot
sections.content:
```
Failed to start Load/Save Screen Backlight Brightness of backlight:amdgpu_bl0
```

If the backlight brightness cannot be restored at boot and is therefore always set to a value of 100% or (close to) 0%, you can add fbcon=nodefer as a workaround to the kernel parameters. See kernel issue.
